greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: coefficients of the Laplacian polynomial of the n-path graph P_n.
comment: Version of A053122 with row-ending 0's and differing signs.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Path Graph
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Laplacian Polynomial
maple: if n <= k then 0 elif k = 0 then (-1)^n*n
else S(n-1, k-1) - S(n-2, k) - 2*S(n-1, k) fi end:
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..10); # _Peter Luschny_, Apr 03 2020
mathematica: CoefficientList[LinearRecurrence[{2 - x, -1}, {-x, (-2 + x) x}, 10], x] // Flatten
CoefficientList[Table[(-1)^(n + 1) x^(1/2) ChebyshevU[2 n - 1, -Sqrt[x]/2], {n, 10}], x] // Flatten
CoefficientList[Table[(2^-n ((2 - Sqrt[-4 + x] Sqrt[x] - x)^n - (2 + Sqrt[-4 + x] Sqrt[x] - x)^n))/Sqrt[(-4 + x)/x], {n, 10}] // Expand // FullSimplify, x] // Flatten
program: # Returns the triangle as a matrix.
xref: Cf. A053122 (version lacking row-ending 0's and with differing signs).
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Apr 09 2017
